Name: Deadliest Catch Sea Adventure Board Game
Description: Now you can be the captain of your all-time favorite Deadliest Catch ship: Time Bandit, Wizard, Northwestern, or Cornelia Marie and compete for the most "red gold" aka Alaskan King Crag. Survive the hazards of the Bering Sea as you race to drop your crab pots and return to port with the largest crab count. The board game that recreates all the winning show action! Game includes quad-fold game board, 18 navigation cards, 20 crab pots, 6 hazard chips, Coast Guard chip, and 4 ship markers

Name: 100 Really Dumb Things You Have to do While Playing This Game
Description: In 100 Really Dumb Things YOU have to DO while PLAYING this game, players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably at each other. Players might draw cards that tell them to salute the nearest wall, do the Chicken Dance around the room and meow like a cat while wearing a cat nose. Other cards set off chain reactions among players. Your actions might cause players to tap their heels together and say 'There's no place like home,' do a hula dance using a tambourine, pretend to jump rope or hiss like a snake. One dumb thing definitley leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

Name: Osh Vegas Police
Description: A cooperative game in which 1-4 players race against time to jointly solve crimes. The game board is a map of the city of Osh Vegas. Crimes occur randomly throughout the city. The police move to the crime scenes as allowed by a special movement die. Then using five 6-sided dice, crimes are solved if the police on the scene can roll 3 of the same number. To win, the players must solve all of the crimes before time runs out.

Name: Eminent Domain: Bonus Planets
Description:
This mini-expansion contains 9 bonus planets for use with Eminent Domain.  It includes 3 Prestige planets and 6 Utopian planets.  These planets are intended to spice up the game and add an interesting twist to the Survey role, making your choice of planets, and therefore your strategy, more interesting

Prestige Planets
There are 3 Prestige planets, each with a different cost, representing important or famous worlds.  These planets are worth a high amount of Influence, but they do not help to satisfy any research requirements, they do not provide symbols, and they do not have any resource slots.

Utopian Planets
There are 6 Utopian planets, each with the same cost, representing impressive utopias where any type of resource can be produced and any type of technology can be studied.  The resource slots on Utopian planets can store any type of resource, so when producing a resource you may choose which type to produce.

In addition, when researching technology, a Utopian planet counts as any type of planet you already have for purposes of satisfying planet requirements.  However, for each research role you may only count 1 Utopian planet this way.  For example, if you have 1 Advanced planet and 2 Utopian planets in your Empire, then you could choose Advanced technology cards from level 1 or 2 (but not level 3).  You could not choose any Metallic or Fertile technology cards unless you also have planets of those types in your Empire.

Name: Church Windows
Description:
From the box: The beautiful stained glass windows of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John need your help.  Use all of your cards to rebuild the apostles and you win Church Windows!

User summary: Players "rebuild" church windows by swapping cards from their hands to mixed up windows on the table.  Once a window is repaired, a new window in the opposite color (red or black) can be built next to the repaired window.

The player who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

Name: Football Card Game
Description:
From the box:
Hours OF FUN for 1 or 2 players.  Play at home or carry along to play while traveling.

YOU CALL THE PLAYS! Run...Kick...Pass.  There are touchdowns, pass interceptions, fumbles, penalties, field goals, in fact, everything but a water boy.
All the thrills of a real football game are enjoyed while playing this game. Never two games alike.

Play using regulations football rules of your choice: high school,college or professional rules.  Se enclosed cards with rules on how to play and instructions on easy way to keep track of te first downs, line of scrimmage, etc.

Name: Peanut Butter Party
Description:
From the instructions: Peanut Butter Party is a fun, fast-paced game based on answering riddles.  Follow the friendly animals from the Peanut Butter Pond series along a path filled with special places.  Answer exciting riddles as your travel toward the pond.

User summary: Answer riddles correctly to draw "Peanut Butter Party" cards, which allow movement along the board, either one or two spaces, or to one of six designated "Special Places".  Reach the end goal (pond) and answer a final riddle to win the game.

Name: American Basketball
Description:
Statistical replay game on basketball, featuring many different expansion sets. Basic game is very simple: each team is rated for points made, points allowed, rebounds and assists, plus it has a special value based on historical performance in the tournament (used to give a possible random variation to a few of his ratings). Opposing teams compare their value and a die is rolled for each team to determine the score. It is a fast replaying simulation, with a good bit of accuracy in the final result.

For the moment the following sets are available (directly from the designer, Roberto Chiavini or from Wargamer Vault): WNBA (all seasons) NBDL (all seasons), original ABA (all seasons), all the NBA from 1951 in single decades

Name: Olympic handball
Description:
Peculiar statistical replay game on a minor sport game, handball, dedicated to all the editions of this sport in the olympic games.
Basic system is really simple, as each team is rated for goal made and allowed, plus a killer instinct capacity (the ability to win point to point games) and a random modifier based on historical performance in the competition. Opposing teams compares values, then a die is rolled for each team to determine the final score (after a few possible modifications).
Very simple and very fast to replay an entire tournament in a very short time

Name: Mutation
Description:
This is a strategic dice placement game for 2 - 4 players.  Each player takes the roll of a strain of bacteria in a petri dish, and begins to mutate and grow their strain in an effort to be the biggest.

Every turn you roll two D6 spotted dice, and then place one of these on the board according to a set of simple rules. Do you extend your strain or do you focus on breaking apart an opponents? Do you risk expansion into a contested portion of the playing area or do you focus on strengthening, but not lengthening, your strain?  Every turn has interesting and strategic decisions to be made all from a simple roll of two dice.

Name: Horde of the Dead Minigame
Description:
You are Giraffe the hero of this game and you arrived in a small inn. Suddenly during the night something was attacking the inn. It’s a horde of ZOMBIES!!!. Nobody survive except you and the inn keeper’s daughter, Mari-chan. Survive the game in 3 nights without anyone dying.

This game is inspired by the genre tower of defense, where a horde of zombie, comes and attack the inn wave by wave. Your job is to control Giraffe, Mari-chan and occasionally Dogmeat by moving them through the inn, defending against the zombies, set barricade, buy stuff to upgrade and protecting Mari-chan while surviving yourself.

You need at least 1 six sided-die (the more the faster the game goes), 4 counters(different kind or colour) in which 1 of them represent zombie (which you need at least 7), a pencil and an eraser to jot down equipment, hp, bp and so on.

download the game here http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2010/11/horde-of-dead-minigame.html

Name: Ramar of the Jungle, The New Jungle Game
Description:
This is a spin and move game based on the television series Ramar, the White Witch Doctor.  The object is to lead your Safari safely through the jungle until you find the hidden treasure of the Golden Goddess.

Players spin and the player with the highest number goes first. Each player in turn will spin and move their pawn along the jungle path. If you land on one of the various assists or penalties, perform the action described. Two or more players may occupy the same space, unless you collectively decide to place them the next spot behind that pawn. You must land on the final destination by an exact spin to reach the finish. The first player to reach the Golden Goddess is the winner.

Game for ages 7-10

Name: Battle of Kyuden Tonbo
Description:
Brand new introductory set for Legend of the Five Rings. Features the Dragon Clan and Lion Clan in two pre-built decks ready to play right out of the box.  A lavish rulebook quickly teaches new players everything they need to know to start defending the Empire of Rokugan.

The set also comes with many choice rares for the current environment, giving players a quick foot up in the game!  Combine with the free Imperial Gift set (150 cards free!) and you'll be serving with honor in no time!

(publisher blurb0
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Teekessel im Quadrat
Description:
From the publisher:

A compact collection of card games about and with homonyms, so-called "Teekessel / Teapots". The cards show 240 photos which display everyday views as well as extraordinary motives and perspectives. The players try to discover the "Teekessel" in the pictures and to combine the cards according to certain rules.
The complexity of the games varies from easy to difficult. They provide challenges as regards perception, quickness, knowledge, wit, creativity and language competence.

The games have been designed for cross-generational playing. They can be played within the family as well as in the contexts of language teaching and creativity training. So far Teekessel im Quadrat is available only in German.

Name: Karnak
Description:
User summary:

Theme - A fortune telling game based on cards and pendulum. Played solo or between two players with roles of questioner (later on just Q) and interpreter (N). The interpreter leads the game and the questioner is the one receiving information about his/her home, work, personality, love, future and past.

Game-play - The game-play is divided into two phases 1) the card turning and 2) the pendulum swinging.

1) The card turning phase starts by picking up the proper coloured scarabs to the game board; the hair, eyes and favourite colour of the Q. The Q shuffles the purple 54 card deck and hands it over to N. N divides the deck into 3 separate decks of 18, 9 and 27 cards. The cards are dealt on the game board in the order 18, 27 and 9. The 18 cards are dealt on locations shown at the front page of the rule leaflet. The cards have 6 words in them and one of those is picked depending which is forming a pyramid with the game board (the black half of the pyramid on the left side of the card and the white half of the pyramid on the game board). While the cards are dealt, the N questions the Q if the word on the cards have any special meaning. The forming words are related to either home (1st vertical row), work (2nd), personality (3rd), love (4th), future (5th) or past (6th), depending which vertical row the cards are placed to. The 27 cards are then dealt on the game board (some restrictions apply, see the rule leaflet). Then the deck of 9 cards is used as a key to whole interpretation. At last the rest cards of the deck of 27 are used to check if something is being dominant on some areas of the Q's life. The final interpretations varies each playing time.

2) The pendulum swinging phase starts by placing the four decks of 28 cards onto the game board. The decks are placed on lower part of the game board, around the pyramid (letter A shown on the first page of the rule leaflet). The decks represents the areas of home, work, personality and love. The players decide one of the four categories and Q decides a question he/she wants to get answered related to that category. The transparent pyramid is placed on the game board and the pendulum is used for random number selection. There is numbers of 1-28 around the pyramid on the game board and the random pendulum swing decides the number of the chosen card. The N reads the text on the proper card to the Q. Same is repeated to other categories and questions.

Goal of the game - Interpreting the message gotten with cards and pendulum and gaining more self-consciousness.

The game includes:

1 game board
1 transparent pyramid
1 pendulum
4 decks of cards (28 cards each)
1 purple deck of cards (54 cards)
2 bags including different coloured scarab buttons
1 rule leaflet (4 pages)

From Finnish intro on the rule leaflet:

"Karnak on kiehtovan jännittävä ennustuspeli, jota voi pelata yksin tai yhdessä. Se perustuu eräisiin muinaisegyptiläisiin mysteereihin ja kulttuuriperinteisiin. Koska peli on tunnettujen astrologian ja horoskooppien asiantuntijoiden suunnittelema, pelaajat voivat sen avulla myös kehittää omaa kuudetta aistiaan ja salattuja kykyjään. Luonnollisesti sitä voidaan pelata myös pelkkänä pelinä, mutta moni varmasti mielellään käyttää sitä oman itseymmärryksensä kehittämiseen ja hankkii sen avulla tietoja sisimmästä minuudestaan. Näitä tietoja voi sitten soveltaa toisten, kenties vähemmän onnekkaiden ihmisten auttamiseen."

Name: Königsberg '45
Description:
Königsberg ´45( # 104-1 ), is a boardgame covering the Soviet attack on East Prussia in 1945.

The game handles the 20 first days of the attack starting on the 13th of January 1945. The 3rd Belorussian Front under command of Cherniakhovsky launches an attack into the northeast of East Prussia while the 2nd Belorussian Front, commanded by Rokossovsky, one day later starts an attack from the south east. However, Army Group Mitte, under the command of Reinhardt, puts up an astonishing defence desperatly pushing the Soviets back.
The time is however on the Soviet side and when the defence finally crumbles there is nothing left to withstand the Soviet troops to ravage the country.

Königsberg ´45 is taught in 30 minutes and easy to digest yet a challenge even for the more experienced players. It is built around the same system of rules that shaped Stargard Solstice, KÃ¶nigsberg '45 and Army Group Narwa and utilizes a Command chit-pull system to activate HQ, which in turn allow their controlled combat units to move and attack.
Each turn is two days and the game has 10 turns.

Components:

     50 x 70cm-size map
     280 die-cut counters
     1 six-sided die
     Rules
     Box
Families: Series: Guerrilla Print (Three Crowns Game Productions)
Series: WWII Battle Series (Three Crowns Game Productions)

Name: Village Run
Description:
Banana village is having their annual village run. This year you entered to win the Banana Cup, but you are not the only one who hungers for the cup.

Village Run is for 2 or more player game where players roll for speed and hoping to take the first place. During the game players will get power up box to take advantage over their opponents. The game use a unique speed system, in where players will have a decision whether to stay on the same speed or try to roll their luck to speed up or getting slow. Village Run also features combat in which players will try to land on a box tile to get an advantage over the other players. The game can be played around 15 minutes and whole lots of exciting laps of Village Run.

Name: Put-In-Bay-Opoly
Description:
The classic Monopoly game. This theme: A game celebrating Island life!

Players roll and move along the board to collect the properties of the Lake Erie area, in the United States. When they have a complete collection of one color, players can build houses and even hotels. If another player lands on a property, the player who's owning it, can ask rent.

The object of the game is to let the other players go bankrupt.

Name: Plan 1919
Description:
Plan 1919 is a variant for 1918: Storm in the West, which was published in Command Magazine Issue #16. Here we assume no decision was reached during the campaigns of 1918, leaving the Allies with the task of driving the Germans from France and Belgium during the sprimg and summer of 1919.

This variant uses the 1918 map and most of the parent game's original counters, along with the new ones (32) provided in this issue. Except as added to or amended in the rules, the standard rules of 1918 apply here unchanged, along with optional rules 16.4, 16.7 and 16.8.

(From the introduction)

Name: Les Deux Bretagnes: Expansion et nouvelles cartes
Description:
Published in Vae Victis nº 77, this expansion adds new cards, rules and counters for the original game Les deux Bretagnes (Vae Victis No. 76) which covers the dynastic struggle in Brittany during XIII and XIVth centuries.

The new cards are added without surpassing the total activation value of the player. They can also replace other cards with same activation value.

The new markers are reminders of some important game events or played cards (Ex. "Bombardes" or "du Guesclin va en Normandie"). They can also be associated with the new cards (the two green markers).

The 3 new characters counters are for "Jeanne de Flandre" and "Jeanne de Penthièvre". The "Jean de Monfort" counter is a variant.

Name: Tibor
Description:
From the back of the box (translated from croatian):

"Tibor becomes a vampire. To return among normal people, Tibor has a long way from his village to the castle of Countess Zarina Sibilskog in which  Kosinius, a scientist created a magic potion for the vampire. Will Kosinius' magic potion help Tibor to become again an ordinary person?"

Content:
1 board
40 playing tiles
10 scoring tiles

In this simple game the players place tiles on a grid, trying to connect their village with their castle (if they place a tile with a garlic on it, they gain a score tile with 1-3 points). The player who first reaches the castle gains ten points.

Name: Spiral Billard
Description: A tabletop dexterity/skills-based game where metallic balls are flicked in a spiral groove with many differently-scored channels. Reaching the end of each route scores points.

Name: Schäfchen ins Trockene
Description:
The lush green grass of irish meadows and a homey shelter provide a pleasurable life for black sheep as well as white ones. A feast for the old lazy wolf. That's why you should keep an eye on your herd with help of the shepherd and his dog.

A strategic two player game about tending sheep. Each player moves sheep around the meadows and either into the shelter for twosomeness or off the board to score. A core mechanic is to keep an eye on blancing the size and composition of the flocks. The wolf will kill one of the sheep in the largest flock and you should make sure its not one of yours! You win by scoring enough points or reduce the opponents sheep so they can no longer mate.

As all the "Mini-Lederspiele" of Hiku-Spiele this game comes with several semi-precious stones in a leather pouch that when opened is the board of the game.

Name: Sinterklaasjournaal Bordspel
Description:
The Game consists of 3 games: The Steamboatgame (Het Stoombootspel), The Giftgame (Het Pakjesspel) and The Memoryvariant.

All games are based on a dutch special-day: Sinterklaas. This is the dutch version of SantaClaus and is celebrated on december 5th each year.

In The Steambootgame players use there playingfigure to collect presents from the hold of the ship on the gameboard. They do no know the value of the present they took.Via stairs and rooms of 3 different colors they attempt to bring them to the deck, to secure them. To do so, they throw a dice with the 3 different colors on it. A player must stop in a room of that color. When 2 players are in the same room, they have to switch presents. Two special actions which are in some rooms give players the chance to look at another players present, or his own, or to catch up with another player who is at max two stories higher in the ship. If all presents are on the deck, the player with the highest value of presents wins the game!

In The Giftgame players buy a few small presents upfront. They agree on the amount of money to be spent. You can also use the chips in the game and play for points.In this game also the colordice is used to decide to what field on the gameboard the player moves his playingfigure to. On each field is a different symbol, each giving a different action. The possible actions are: Take a present, switch presents and open them up, give present away to the player with the fewest presents, all presents in front of the players are passed to your neighbour in a clockwise fasion. and finally open up a present. When there are no more presents in the pile, the game ends. When playing with chips in stead of real presents, the game ends as soon as the last chip is taken from the supply. The player with the most points wins!~

The Memoryvariant is just another memory: There are 2 pairs of 12 different colored-and-valued chips. Turn them up-side-down so the sack is showing, shuffle them, and try to find the matching pairs as in regular memory. The player witrh the most chips wins.

Name: Wend-maze
Description: Wend-maze is a path building game in the Wend family for two to four players. The players use Wend tiles to construct a maze which they are trying to escape from. They have a series of actions they can take to place tiles, move or rotate them, switch the lights on or off, or move along the maze. They roll dice to determine the action they will take. The object of the game is to be the first player to escape from the maze.

Name: Bcmll
Description:
A word game based on the popular Catalan TV show "Bocamoll", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya since 2007. Following the show structure, it is composed by six different tests on words: matching words with their definitions, guessing words from images and symbols, filling-in popular song lyrics with the correct words, deciphering SMS language texts, etc.

The game includes:
- board
- 500 cards
- 4 markers
- bag
- hourglass
- rules booklet

Name: Caçadors de bolets
Description:
A roll-and-move game based on the Catalan TV show "Caçadors de bolets", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya. The players try to win in this particular race of mushroom hunting, correctly identifying mushroom types.

The game includes:
- board
- 6 markers
- 112 mushroom cards
- 300 cards
- rulebook

Name: A 16th Century Mediterranean Galley Wargame
Description: It is a 12-page booklet describing the rules for a naval battle, intended to use with Navwar's miniatures. Each ship has maximum movement, fighting value and armament. Players simultaneously decide about movement, then each ship can fire. There are also rules covering ramming, close combat and morale.

Name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – The Duke of Cadwallon
Description:
(User Summary)
A mini-expansion to the original game.
The Duke comes with one painted miniature as well as the Duke's card, two color bases, and rules for including the Duke in the game.

Name: IQ: A szerencse és logika játéka!
Description: The title translates as IQ - the game of luck and logic. A player in her turn rolls a die, moves her pawn horizontally or vertically on a grid and on certain spaces gets a question (an IQ test item). If answers correctly, she gets 2, 4 or 6 points. The winner is the first player who arrives to the goal (the opposite corner) first, having at least 30 points. The game comes with 220 question cards and two additional IQ tests.

Name: Shuuro: Turanga
Description:
From the back of the box:

TURANGA – an expansion for Shuuro.

Turanga transforms Shuuro into a four-player battle.
Together with your ally on the opposite side of the board, get ready to fight for supremacy. But watch out: only with perfect timing and harmony of intents, is your team going to achieve victory!

Requires a copy of Shuuro to play.

Name: Drôles d'animaux
Description:
The game contains 60 cards, these are divided in 3 times 20 each numbered from 1 to 20.  The three categories are: body, face and legs.

The cards are then divided between all the players.  Each player gets the same amount of faces, bodies and legs.  Now the players have to make the most animals with the same number on all the three body parts.

The rest of the cards they can exchange with other players.  There are different ways to do this in the rulebook.  The player with the highest number of animals reconstituted won.

(User Summary)

Name: Le concert des animaux
Description:
The cards all show a couple of different animal types.  There are six different animals - donkey, frog, rooster, cat, cow and pig - on the cards and there are one, two or three of them on each card.   The cards are dealt, in his turn the player turns the top card of his stack and places in front of him.

If somebody sees a series - i.e. one, two and three animals of same type on one card - it makes the noise of this animal and gets all the played cards. Player who calls 4 times first is the winner. Whomever calls wrong must give one card to other players as a penalty. Who has no cards left is eliminated.

Name: Le jeu des fruits
Description:
In Le jeu des fruits you have to get rid of all of your cards.  There are six sorts of fruit on the cards: pears, bananas, plums, strawberries, oranges or pineapples. Each fruit is now 0-5 times on the cards.

A player must always play a card that has more fruit on it then the previous card that has been played in one of the fruit categories.  For example, if the visible card shows two pears, three plums and a banana, you can play any card that contains three or more pears, two or more bananas, four or more plums.

Name: Tricky Double
Description:
Tricky Double works a bit on the principle of Raj but makes it an 'adult' version.  Players simultaneous choose a card and reveal it and then have to select a second card and reveal this one too.  You win with the combination of these two cards.

The lower cards in the deck hold coins, the person who gets the most of these coins wins the game. The lower the card, the more points it has.  So if you want to score a lot of points you will also have to play out a low card from your hand but still want to get the highest result in the end.

(User summary)

Name: Marchand de sable
Description:
The game has two phases: first you have to put all the stars on the board and after this you can turn of the light and they will glow in the dark.  Now that we are in the dark the second phase starts.

Each at a turn takes away one star from the board.  The player who's star stays on the board as last wins the game.  It sounds easy but since you are in the dark, a good memory will help.

The game contains:
- A large die
- Twelve twinkling starts
- A board 
- A sandman

(User summary)

Name: Heilig of Geilig?
Description:
Heilig of Geilig? is a dutch partygame.  It can be translated as Holy or Horny?

The players take trivia cards on which a 3 different hints are stated.  These are vague and ambiguous and describe an object.  The players have to guess the answer to get points.  When they get it wrong they show their own 'horny' nature.

All players start at the same starting point on the board, this is in the middle of the board.  On the one side are the holy/heilige points, on the other side the horny/geilige pionts. The oldest player begins.  He takes a card and chooses one of the three hints from the card and reads it to his neighbour his leftside.  When the player guesses the object with this one hint he may move up to 4 places.  If a second hint is needed he moves up 3 places.  After a third hint he can move up 2 places.  But if passes after the 3 hint he has to move back 1 place.  When he guessed wrong he has to move back 2 spaces.  The game ends when a player gets at the top of the holy points.

The game contains:
- A board
- Pawns
- 300 playing cards

Name: Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files
Description:
Crime & Mystery - that says it all. The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence"-cards. Afterwards, all the cards are shuffled and 7 cards are drawn. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

In this game you have to listen closely, remember and combine the facts in the right way. After 2 cases (approximately 20 min.) the game ends and the points are summed up.

––––––––––––––––

In Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files, dem neuen, ungewöhnlichen Kriminal-Spiel für bis zu sechs Spieler muss man genau zuhören können, messerscharf kombinieren und braucht ein erstklassiges Gedächtnis, um an Hand der Indizien und Hinweise den oder die tatsächlichen Täter zu überführen.

Die Spieler übernehmen die Rollen von Detektiven, die eng mit Scotland Yard, der englischen Kriminalpolizei, zusammenarbeiten. Am Anfang des Spieles wird einer von vier Fällen herausgesucht. Die Spieler entscheiden sich im Anschluss daran, welchen der acht Verdächtigen sie observieren wollen, so dass sie einen präzisen Bericht über ihren Verdächtigen vortragen können. Dieser Bericht beruht auf den gezogenen Indizienkarten, die vor dem Beginn der Observation gezogen werden. Die Indizienkarten sind jeweils auf die verschiedenen Fälle zugeschnitten.

Nachdem alle Ermittler ihren Bericht innerhalb einer definierten Zeitspanne vorgetragen haben, müssen die Spieler verschiedene Fragen und Aussagen bezüglich der vorgetragenen Indizien mit den Verdächtigen in Einklang bringen.

Der Spieler, dem dies gelingt und einen Verdächtigen erfolgreich als Täter überführt, gewinnt die Partie. Ein Spiel besteht dabei aus zwei Partien, sprich zwei Fällen.

Name: Brewtown Brou-ha ha
Description:
A bi-collaborative game where two teams of gamers group together to try to accomplish game objectives and stay alive for the duration of this game set in downtown Milwaukee, WI USA. The game will involve dice-based combat, but will have multiple paths to victory for both the monsters and the humans, both fighting for different things.

One group will consist of six monsters: a cow; a crayfish; an asian carp; a gorilla; a bluegill; and two deep-tunnel sewer rats. The other group will consist of humans, plus humans with functions like workmen, fire fighters, police, nat'l guard, and some super-humans like Lara Croft and ninjas might appear during gameplay.

The game is driven foremost by the HO scale minis used in the game, and the plastic monsters. The toy value is what this Über-Ameritrash game is about.There will be multiple rule sets developed. Really, this game started with the toys, and a desire to improve an old game or two, while thematically morphing it into a game which featured downtown Milwaukee, WI USA.

At this point it's a prototype. The game is a homage to The Creature That Ate Sheboygan, borrows from Heorscape and Monsters Menace America, requires some D&D features like THACO, and has lots of other options for tweaks and alt games.

The "ha ha" is deliberate in the name because of the twisted humor woven into the fabric of the game. The "bronze fonz" is on the map, and either side will get a bonus for either destroying it or simply rubbing it for good luck. Names for the creatures also have built-in humor:

Vince Gill: the bluegill who is also a Packer fan, but hates Milwaukeeans because of their fascination with the Friday Fish Fry. His desire is to crush restaurants which serve fish.

Son of Samson: the undead giant son of the most famous ex-resident of the Milwaukee Zoo, whose goal is to get to the top  of the Firstar/U.S. Bank tower and fling poo.

Carpie Diem: an asian carp, who seized headlines recently as the no.1 environmental enemy to Lake Michigan. He can jump across city blocks and smash things under his weight. Very easily distracted by the Ladybug Club, thinking they are asian lady beetles.

Holey Cow: a sympathizer with O'Leary's Chicago firestarter, this copycow is a Cubs fan and happens to breathe methane gas fires from her four stomachs, and out her nostrils. She's also capable of making massive cowpies which block city streets.

'Hood Ratz: a pair of residents from our failed Deep Tunnel system, these rodents are skaven mad *wink* and capable of chewing through even the five foot thick walls of the Fed Bldg. They're also attracted to hip-hop music.

Rebecca the Boiling Crayfish: (no relation to our new Lt. Governor of WI) she's looking for her crawdaddy in one of the restaurants that serve her brethren. The humans are in hot water this time.

The game narrative is such that an event has taken place that, combined with the deep tunnel sewer failure, has caused six local creatures to grow in size and terrorize Brewtown.

The Federal Bldg. is within the now quarantined section of Brewtown, and the goals of the monsters are many, but they have to achieve them before they are killed or the feds are able to call in the antidote. Meanwhile, the humans are to stay alive and kill monsters,while protecting buildings from fires, repairing blocked roads, and achieving other goals along the way.

There are several groups of humans:

Firefighters: complete with a new ladder truck, these six individuals have axes and hoses in hand *wink* to face any challenge.

Police: one car (Milwaukee police are grossly underfunded) and a handful of officers help with attacks, rescue civilians, and keep the peace among the surviving humans.

National Guard: these weekend warriors with five tanks were setting up for maneuvers downtown, ending in at the Veterans Memorial nearby when this hit. They've not got much live ammo with them for this reason, but they have plenty of rubber bullets of all sizes-and they look scary as hell. The can fly in one helicopter from General Mitchell Airport in a couple of rounds, and it will have the firepower they need, but the rest of the military is on furlough.

Municipal Construction: several men on a job site with a huge dump truck, a CAT backhoe, and two CAT scoopshovels. They're tough enough to fight the monsters on their own with their equipment and they're experts at "catcalls".

Waste Management: one unmanned truck full of Milwaukee's finest refuse, abandoned.

Superhumans: activated at different times in the game when humans accomplish certain goals: a Lara Croft lookalike, with the guns to prove it; a ninja; two advanced swordplay students from the T'ai Chi Ch'uan center of Milwakee, and their leader Mike. Mike's wearing a Yoda costume he found at the Milwaukee Film office, and his mastery of push hands gives him the equivalent of the "force push". He hopes the creatures watched the trilogy, and fear him...

The two collaborative groups struggle until the game ends for a variety of reasons. There are several paths of victory for either team.

Name: Komputer
Description:
A 2 player board game.

The purpose of the game is to find as many combinations as it’s possible which sum is exactly 10. Every combination has to consist of exactly three digits situated on three neighbouring areas connected with edges or with corners. Each area can only be used once in a combination.

Players take turns finding such combinations. Upon finding one the active player may place his pawn on the board on the first or the third digit of the desired combination (never second). On any one area can only be placed one pawn. Therefore such area can be part of combination, but cannot be chosen to place a pawn on it.

The winner is the player who has found more combinations (indicated by the number of pawns on the board). If both players used the same number of pawns the winner is the player who has situated his pawns on areas which digits sum up to a higher number.

Name: Ben 10: Alien Attack
Description:
From the box:
It has been 5 years since Ben used Omnitrix. He once again uses the all powerful Omnitrix when he finds out that his grandfather Max is missing. New alien army does not make his life any easier.
Help Ben in his new adventure.

Content:
-game board
-4 pawns
-rules
-12 tiles

Game Play

Place each of the 12 tiles next to the game board. Each player then chooses one of the colors and places their pawn on the to the corresponding space on the board.
Youngest player begins.
When ever you stop on Ben 10 symbol, you gain one tile.

In game:
with 2 players each can get up to 6
with 3 players up to 4
with 4 players up to 3

When ever someone have the necessary amount of tiles, then all tile spaces are deactivated. Pawns cannot fight each other, but when they are on the same space, then the one who was there earlier give one tile to the player that just got there. If he has no tiles to give, he misses his turn

Special spaces

Alien X - Ben 10 can move faster by 3
Ben, Kevin and Gwen - miss 1 turn
Green circle - Ben has a date with Julia. Miss 2 turns.
Max - miss 3 turns.
Jetray - Ben can move faster by 4

Winning

First player to get needed amount of tiles and reaches finish is the winner.

Name: Tic Tic Boom
Description:
You and your rivals are locked in a struggle of heroic proportions.  Only assembling “KABOOM”, the ultimate weapon, can end the mayhem and crown you the top-dog of Superhero Land.  Use your wits to activate special powers to defuse opponents and defend yourself from the onslaught of incoming attacks.

Tic Tic Boom is the explosive new family card game chock-full of strategy and sabotage.  Set to a retro comic book motif, and manufactured on durable transparent plastic; the cards are as fun to pick up as they are to play.

Included are two entirely different games.  Tic Tic Boom “Classic” offers something for all ages and skill levels.  Players race to spell “KABOOM” on a communal board, while activating special powers along the way.  It’s quick to learn and full of surprises.  Tic Tic Boom “Advanced” is for gamers who thirst for a little more strategy, cunning, and sabotage. This game introduces Power Attacks, which are made by combining your cards to spell words such as BAM, BOOM, or K.O. These score points and provide even higher levels of high-jinx.

With more strategy than Uno and more excitement than Rummy, Tic Tic Boom is something the whole family will enjoy!

Name: The Wreckers' Tower Game
Description:
First title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go Down to the Sea".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained within the book in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find: the book, a set of playing cards consisting of a rucksack; codebook; torch; measure card; map — and to refresh you on your journey, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

Name: The Wailing Lighthouse Game
Description:
Fifth title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go to Demon's Rocks".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a codebook, measure card, torch, map, and rucksack — and to refresh you in your adventure, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

Name: Storm the Castle
Description:
From the designer:
"Storm The Castle - Print, make and play this adventure game. You are a knight and you have to storm through the castle and overthrow the King! Along the adventure you run into guards, wandering beasts and more. Totally free game that you can print up, assemble and play. Including a paper dice if you don't have one."

From the Rules:
"You progress through the castle by rolling six sided dice. Whatever number shows on the dice is the number of squares forward you can move. If you land on a square with a red number in it you must refer to that number in this [the] rule book and follow the instructions."

Name: TechCommander
Description:
From back of book:

TechCommander is a fast paced sci-fi action tactical game that puts you in the command chair of a hi tech operations center leading an elite squad on dangerous missions!  TechCommander combines miniature gaming with the sci-fi action seen in first person shooters and sci-fi real time strategy video games. The game has powerful Mechanized Strike Vehicle units (called MSV’s for short) that can destroy targets in seconds, but also has the ultimate in elite power armor infantry units.  These units are based on a possible progression of future soldier programs in development in the modern day, and are  equipped with technology to keep them agile, powerful and somewhat safe from the monster MSV’s roaming the landscape. The infantry are jump jet equipped, and in many cases, running a visibility and sensor masking stealth suit. Many also have capacitance based shield meaning if you do not fully eliminate them, they will recharge!  The MSV may be powerful, but left unguarded, it is no match for a crack squad of  USSC Force Recon Marines!  TechCommander MSVs are fairly large miniatures, standing anywhere from four inches to a foot high. They use a peg-together system so that swapping out weapons and gear for a battle that requires a custom load out is easy!

Name: Friesematenten: Volle Vierzig
Description:
German Expansion card to Friesematenten from Amigo, available at Essen 2010.

German Text: 
"Spiel die Karte gegen einen Mitspieler deiner Wahl. Du erhälst von ihm €40. Hat er keine €40, bekommst Du all sein Geld. Er erhält dafür die Karte und kann sie ab der nächsten Runde einsetzen."

"Play the card against a player of your choice.  You get €40 from him.  If he has less than €40, you get all of his money.  He gets this card and can sit out of the next round"

The illustration shows the designer, Friedemann Friese.

Name: Last Night on Earth 'All Hallows Eve II: The Ritual' Scenario
Description:
From Flying Frog's Website:

Once again it is All Hallows Eve and the dead are rising from their slumber. Father Joseph has devised a plan to send the angry dead back to their graves, once and for all, but it won’t be easy. He has prepared a holy ritual at the center of town; marking ritual circles on the ground, reciting incantations, and assembling all manner of powerful artifacts to aid him. But the ritual is not yet complete, and the hour grows late!

This scenario requires the Growing Hunger Expansion set to play (you must have 8 L-Shaped boards). This Scenario can also support up to 9 players (up to 6 Hero Players and 3 Zombie Players).
Families: Series: Last Night on Earth Game Engine (Flying Frog Production)

Name: Top 40 Nederlandse Editie
Description:
Trivia game about Dutch Artists in the Dutch top 40. It's a music trivia game. The player that answers the most questions correctly wins the game. The players have to sing a song, listen to music and guess the artist or songtitle.

The person that collects 6 chips first, wins the game.

Contents
1 rulebook
110 cards with 660 questions in 6 different categories
1 CD with 99 musicfragments
36 chips
1 dice

Name: Combat Commander: Resistance!
Description:
Combat Commander: Resistance! (or CC:R) expands upon Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean by adding partisans and their war behind the front lines. This fourth volume of the Combat Commander wargame series features special rules and components for fighting with Partisan forces against the Axis nations of Europe.

The new CC:R playbook covers the following:

     Random Scenario Generator Update, including the Partisan Leader Table and Fortification OB
     Definition of the Partisan Faction, its Unit Structure, Stats and Weapons
     Rules for Irregular Melee, Sewers and Sighting Markers
     New Orders: Infiltrate and Muster
     New Actions: Knife, No Quarter and Trap
     New Events: Inexperience, Patriotism and Stealth


In addition to the new playbook, the game includes 3 back-printed game maps (6 maps total), 6 double-sided scenario sheets (12 scenarios total), one counter sheet (units and markers), a 36-card Partisan Fate Deck and a 19-card Partisan Force Deck. The new maps depict specific historical locations in Greece, Hercegovina, Eastern Bosnia, Byelorussia, Croatia and Western Bosnia.

The scenarios included in CC:R are:
 
     62 Bessarabian Nights II is a new version of Scenario 7 originally published in Combat Commander: Europe, set in a German rear area as Soviet forces press German forces back into the Carpathian Mountains, April 1944; 
     63 Praise the Lord and Pass the Ammunition set in Rouen France with FFI partisans moving quickly and elusively to attack elements of the German 2nd SS Panzer Division looking for a place to rest, 30 August 1944; 
     64 Predator Becomes Prey, set outside Leskovic, Albania, with ELAS partisans in a prepared ambush against elements of the German 1st Gebirgsjäger Division, whose commander suspecting a ruse changed his attack plans, 27 June 1943;
     65 Road Trip set at Cressensac, southern France, with FFI partisan forces ambushing the German 4th SS Panzergrenadier Regimental HQ, 8 June 1944;
     66 Those are not Birds set in the Bryansk Forest in Byelorussia, with Soviet partisans of the Orlov Regiment preparing a trap for elements of the German 707th Security Division during Operation Vogelsang, 8 June 1942;
     67 The Orient Express set at the south end of the Gorgopotamos Bridge near Lamia, Greece, with ELAS partisans seeking to suppress the Italian Garrison while British Demolition commandos prepare to blow the bridge during Operation Harling, 25 November 1942; 
     68 Tito’s Trick set at Jablanica, Hercegovina, at the railroad bridge crossing of the Neretva River, with Partisans attempting to seize the bridgehead and destroy the Chetnik forces blocking the Partisan escape from German forces (during the 4th Enemy Offensive), 28 February 1943;
     69 Compagnie Scamaroni II is a new version of Scenario 58 originally published in Combat Commander: Normandy, set at night in the Vaucelles neighborhood of Caen just before the Orne River,18 July 1944;
     70 Appointment at Daliki set in a remote village south of Lepel, Byelorussia, with Soviet partisans of an important Operative Center suddenly trapped by a well-executed German rear-area clearing operation, 26 June 1943;
     71 Valley of the Heroes set outside the village of Tjentište, Eastern Bosnia, at the Sutjeska River, where trapped Partisan units fought their way through a weak point in the German-Croatian lines, escaping once again although at great cost (during the 5th Enemy Offensive), 14 May 1943;
     72 Thunderstorm set on the island of KorÄula on the Croatian Adriatic coast, with Partisans of the Dalmatian Brigade attempting to buy enough time for their comrades to evacuate from surrounding German units of the 118th Jäger Division (during the 6th Enemy Offensive), 23 December 1943; and
     73 No Quarter set at the town cemetery outside Drvar, Western Bosnia, with Partisans of the Lika Division in a ferocious showdown with elements of the 500th SS Fallschirmjäger Battalion after a spectacular but failed attempt to seize Tito in his country HQ (during the 7th Enemy Offensive), 25 May 1944.


 
NOTE: Combat Commander: Resistance! is not a complete game. It requires ownership of both Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean to play.
 Developer -- Kai Jensen

Name: The Aztec Market: 'Ayudarjugando' expansion
Description:
Expansion for the base game 'The Aztec Market'.

In November 2010, NESTORGAMES ran a contest on boardgamegeek.com, where the participants had to create new tiles for the original game "The Aztec Market". All of the profits derived from the sales of this expansion will be donated to www.ayudarjugando.org. Ten tiles where selected by Néstor Romeral Andrés (producer) and Victor Melo Barbero (base game designer) to conform this expansion.

NESTORGAMES wants to thank all the participants of this contest. A wonderful group of altruist designers.

The Aztec Market: "Ayudarjugando" expansion includes 10 tiles of the same size as the ones in the original game, and an orange counter.

The tiles:


     The Hairdresser, by Joan Ribera.
     The Astronomer, by Mark Gerrits.
     The Black Market, by Diego Ibañez.
     The Pyramids (4 tiles), by Lee Valentine.
     The thief, by Lee Valentine.
     El trocador, by Sergio Camina.
     The Gambler, by Mark Gerrits.

Name: Uskumatud Seiklused Energiamaal
Description:
From the publisher:

Incredible Adventures in Energy Land is a board game created for the employees of Eesti Energia (Estonian Energy) to gain a better insight into the values of the company. It’s a family adventure game combining strategic elements with the luck factor inherent to board games.

The game route has to be created at the beginning of every new game. Thus, the game is always fresh, surprising and visually exciting. With the help from six characters - creatures connected to a certain form of energy - the player has to complete different assignments and answer questions related to different forms of energy by getting reacquainted with the basic knowledge or by learning something new.

The visual language is bright, colorful and playfully modified from different Nordic mythologies. The characters and the Energy Land itself are inspired by all the different energy forms known to man.

Name: Kings Court
Description:
Kings Court is a Western Chess variant played on a large 8X12 board.

The game incorporates the standard array of King, Queen, 2 knights, 2 bishops and 2 rook.

Kings Court then adds two Chancellor and two jester pieces.

From the game company's website:

THE CHANCELLOR-Has two possible moves (1) it can move one or two square in any direction. (2) it can move one square on the rank or file and then while still moving away from the square from which it started, moves one square on the diagonals. This is not a line move but a move from point to point and can not be obstructed by any other piece. See figure 1.

THE JESTER- Moves one or two squares on the diagonals. Unlike the Bishop the Jester can change directions while in motion, if desired. It may not return to the square from which it stared in the same move. See figure 2. For the first move from its initial square the jester may jump two square diagonally. All pieces with the exception of the Pawn, capture in the way it can legally move.

The King is also afforded an additional special move;

KING'S FLIGHT- is a move made by the King when in check by the Chancellor. The move is executed by moving the King two squares in any direction instead of its usual one square.

Name: Spartan Chess
Description:
Spartan chess is a chess variant played on a standard 8x8 chess board. The two sides have pieces and pawns with different characteristics and capabilities. Such differences you would expect between opponents on an actual ancient battlefield.

The Black side represents the Spartans and the White the Persians. The Persians have pawns, pieces, an initial placement, and move in accord with the rules of orthodox chess.

The Spartans have two Kings and with the exception of their Kings, every Spartan playing piece moves differently from any piece found in orthodox chess.

Spartan Chess Features:
• A Persian army (white) identical to that of orthodox chess
• A Spartan army led by two Kings
• Spartan pawns (hoplites) that move differently than orthodox pawns
• Spartan pieces that move differently than any found in orthodox chess

Name: Hell's Corner
Description:
Hell's Corner is an ASL historical study released as an insert in Operations Special Magazine #3. It covers the battles that occured along the Matanikau River on Guadalcanal from August to October 1942.

There are five scenarios:


     "First Matanikau" is the Marines attempt to secure Matanikau Village shortly after their landing on Guadalcanal.
     "Bailey's Demise" recounts the failed attempt by the Marines to dislodge the Japanese from the west bank of the Matanikau.
     "Samurai Sunset" features a trapped Japanese Company trying to break out of an encirclement to friendly lines on the west bank of the Matanikau.
     "Whaling Good Time" has a group of marines attempting to expand the bridgehead on the Matanikau against a small Japanese rearguard.
     "The Sand Spit" depicts a fresh group of Japanese reinforcements with armored support attempting to break the Marine defenses near Matanikau.

Name: Glee CD Board Game
Description: It's time to "free your Glee". Show your friends how much you know about the show. Ask questions of your teammates so you can guess the glee character. Then your teammates act, sing, dance, do whatever they must to get you to guess what that character does. All the time you're holding the "Glee-full" holder with the answer card over your head. Hurry, before time runs out and the school bell rings.

Name: Friendly Fire Pack 6
Description:
Friendly Fire Pack 6 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2010 ASL tournament, and a new "ASLSK-style" mapboard.

Scenarios included:

FrF 45 - Totensonntag (Janowice, Poland, 10 September 1939)
FrF 46 - Dutch Courage (Outskirts of Dordrecht, Netherlands, 10 May 1940)
FrF 47 - Cutting off the Hydra's Head (Outskirts of Riga, Latvia, 29 June 1941)
FrF 48 - Bad Moon Rising (Kodorov, Ukraine, 29 August 1941)
FrF 49 - One Last Mighty Hew (West of Sevsk, Russia, 30 September 1941)
FrF 50 - Pavlov's Dogs (Northern Rzhev, Russia, 27 September 1942)
FrF 51 - Bite of the Bassotto (Near San Casciano, Italy, 27 July 1944)
FrF 52 - Dying for Danzig (Olivaer Tor, Gdansk, Poland, 27 March 1945)

Name: Das Super Mario Spiel
Description:
The game's theme is based on the GameBoy Version of Nintendo's "Super Mario Land" from 1989.

Story
Princess Daisy of Sarasaland was kidnapped by the monster Tatanga. Super Mario and Luigi travel through the kingdoms of Birabuto, Muda and Easton to reach the kingdom of Tschai where the princess is held. The first player who reaches Tschai and beats the evil Tatanga and the other players frees the princess and wins the game.

Contents:

     1 Board
     8 Figures in 4 different Colors
     1 Dice
     60 Cards


Flow of Play
Each player has two figures (Mario and Luigi). Players roll a die to determine how far one of their figures can move. The board has some special places like traps and questionmarks. Traps cast the figure some spaces back. Questionmarks let the player draw one of the cards. On these player may find enemies which can be fought by a die roll or special items which let them avoid traps or enemies. The player who reaches the final place with both figures has to defeat the last enemy and the other players by rolling the dice.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Wissens-Spektrum: Nachfüll-Paket
Description: This expansion contains 540 cards with 3200 new questions to the basic game.

Name: NotChess
Description:
NotChess is a game on an 8X* board that is a checker-like game, using pieces called Alternators. Any piece is able to be captured by an opponent whose piece moves onto the square of the piece being captured. (By replacement)

The objective is to become the only player remaining on the board. 
 An Alternator moves as a chess knight when moving from a white square but it moves as a short range chess rook when moving from a black square. A player starts with six pieces on the rank closest to them.

Name: Elephant Checkers
Description:
Elephant Checkers is basically Turkish Checkers played on an Xiangqi Board with a extra rules and additional pieces. 
 Each player starts with 24 pieces (soldiers). The goal of the game is to leave your opponent with no moves (capturing all of their pieces does this nicely), or to promote an Elephant (a promoted Soldier) to King on the point in the center of your opponent's fortress.

As in many checker games captures are obligatory, and a player must choose the move with the most possible captures. 
 Soldiers move one square forward or horizontally. They may also capture an enemy piece (or a series of them) by jumping over it to a vacant junction beyond.

Once across the river a Soldier may move two squares or capture pieces two squares ahead or to the side, or capture a piece an adjacent piece and land two squares past it.

When a Soldier reaches the far side it promotes to an Elephant (the name source).  
 Elephants may move to any vacant junction (since Xiangqi is played on the points, not sqaures) vertically or horizontally. They capture by jumping over an enemy piece, and can continue to any empty square beyond the capture.

"They may promote to King and win the game if on the Throne point in the center of the opposing fortress, but that move counts as a non-capturing move, and can not be made when there is a capture available."

Name: Sour Grapes of Wrath
Description:
From the website:

The Scenario:
One year ago, Robert Killingsworth bought the farm. Six months later, he was dead - leaving his widow, Elizabeth, to tend to their fledgling winery and vineyard on the outskirts of California's wine country. With mounting debts and no clue as to how to run a business, Elizabeth is desperate to sell the farm and recoup her losses. The fierce drought and shaky economy, however, have left the Killingsworth Farm on the market for far too long.

One early autumn day, six people passed through the gates of Killingsworth Farm to see Elizabeth - one of them, a cold-blooded Killer...

Those Present at Killingsworth Farm:

Michael Nightshade: This real estate developer from New York arrived unannounced with plans to buy Killingsworth Farm and develop it into a low-cost housing community. His boss ordered him to obtain the Killingsworth land at any price…

Dr. Chelsea Barren: After suffering a nervous breakdown, this psychiatrist and best-selling author moved to Northern California to relax… but she moved next door to the Killingsworths instead.

Vicki D'Adly: Elizabeth's estranged sister from New Jersey, she and her husband were traveling on vacation when Vicki decided to drop by Killingsworth Farm for a visit… a surprise visit.

Norman D'Adly: A real estate broker from New Jersey and husband to Vicki, Norman is trying to salvage his job and his marriage while traveling across the country on vacation.

Kathryn Lawless: Best friend to Elizabeth, this local librarian and historian has a flare for the eccentric. She lives down the road with her 15 cats and loves true crime - especially the mysterious, unsolved death of Robert Killingsworth

Enrique Graves: This young drifter wandered onto Killingsworth Farm just as Robert and Elizabeth were moving in. Elizabeth took a liking to Enrique and he has lived on the farm ever since - tending to the fields… among other things.

Which of these people has a secret worth killing for? Come to Killingsworth Farm and find out before it is too late!

http://www.whodunitmysteries.com/sour.html

Name: Wizard's Quest
Description: Wizard's Quest is a free print and play game in which you take the role of a wizard about to complete his training. In order to do this, you must defeat a creature called Gegenhound which lives in a place called "The Gether." The wizard advances around a the map via die roll and looks up events in a paragraph book depending on what square he landed in. The game has three ways it can be played: The wizard can learn The Path of Mind, Path of Nature, or The Path of Shadows (dark and deceptive magic). Each of these adds variety to the game by changing the victory conditions. The game also comes with three different difficulty levels which modify the total strength of The Gether.

Name: Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess
Description:
Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess is a free print and play game in which one or two players must explore a labyrinth to rescue a princess in an attempt to win her love.

The game has two paths to victory. In the first, you must try to find at least six of the princesses seven missing belongings in order to curry her favor. In the second, you must kill the labyrinth's minotaur and bring its horns to the princess to prove your courage.

The game uses a paragraph system for events. When a player lands in a square, he or she looks up that square in the paragraph book to see what happens.

In the two player game, the player who retrieves the most missing possessions wins. If one player slays the minotaur then he or she is the winner.

Name: The DragonSlayer
Description:
The DragonSlayer is a free print and play game in which the player must enter seven lairs and slay each the beast that lives there. Each time a beast dies, the player can collect the weapon that the beast had in it's lair. The weapons are humorous and include such things as a double barreled bazooka, a rocket sword, and a tank.

The combat system is very simple. Both the player and the beast have a starting health which is decreased by modified die roll. Depending on your weapon and the beast's strength the damage may be a die roll + 2, a combination of four dice rolled together, or similar modifiers. Each lair and weapon has it's own modifier. Assuming that you survive combat, you're health is automatically reset for the next cave.

Each beast is more difficult to kill than the last (culminating with the dragon in the 7th lair), but each new weapon is more powerful so the player's combat ability increases with the game's difficulty. The game is won by slaying the dragon.

Name: Wicked Wickets
Description:
Wicked Wickets is a cricket based table game suitable for the whole family, cricketers and non-cricketers alike, and can accommodate anything from two to twenty-two players. The game involves selection, bowling, batting, and active fielding, allowing for short over fast action games through to the complex realms of strategy found in test play. Although, like with cricket itself, the basics are simple and easily learnt, it will inevitably take a lifetime to master.

No prior knowledge of cricket is needed to play the game which is suitable for the whole family and up to 22 players. In essence the side that scores the most "runs" wins, though selecting the right players, the order they play, and where they are positioned all affect the outcome of the game. The basics of Wicked Wickets are really quite simple; the bowler throws the ball, in this case the red ball shaped die, and the batsman "hits" it by throwing the buff bat-shaped die. Adding the scores together shows how far the ball goes using the long flight measure. If the batsman's score is higher than the bowlers, the ball "flies" in the air; if the bowler's score is higher than the batsman's, then it is struck along the ground. The yellow counter and dice are used to show which direction the ball goes. The short pace measure is simply used to measure the distance players move and the green die is mostly used for fielding. The game cards give the individual abilities of the players affecting how and where they are used. However, as with most games there is often more to it than first meets the eye. --From the publisher

Official website: http://www.boadiceasbackyard.com/

Name: Out of the Bunker
Description:
Out of the Bunker is a package of 14 ASL scenarios from the ASL Fanzine "Dispatches from the Bunker".

The scenarios include some of MMP's favorites:

     Riding the Coattails, Poland 1939
     Point 247, France 1940
     Brasche Encounter, France 1940
     Headhunting for Bloody Huns, Crete 1941
     Clearing Kamienka, Russia 1941
     First Clash in Tunisia, Tunisia 1942
     Crisis at Kasserine, Tunisia 1943
     Unhappy Trails, Bougainville 1943
     First Crack at Hellzapoppin' Ridge, Bougainville 1943
     The Men From Zadig, France 1944
     Avril Action, France 1944
     Block at Ville-Sur-Illon, France 1944
     A Hotly Contested Crossroads, Germany 1945
     Pursuing Kobayashi, The Philippines 1945

Name: Wit
Description:
Paraphrased from the game's instruction sheet:

A word game for two to four players, utilizing a deck of 112 cards with individual letters on them (4 of each constanant other than Z (of which there are 2) and 6 each of A,E,I,O and U).  Players are dealt a hand of 9 cards. Game play consists of laying cards to form complete words, which are scored against a table. 
A player's turn begins by drawing a card from either the draw pile or the top of the discard pile, then continues with the laying of whatever words the player can make with the cards in his or her hand, then finishes with the laying of an additional card to the discard pile.  Players may also capture words made by other players by adding letters to the played word to form a new word.
A round ends when someone fully discards his hand by playing a word or words.  The player does not need to be able to discard a card if playing all cards into words.


A later version of this game was published together with the dice game Farkel; that game has a deck half the size.

Name: La Maison de Pain d'Epice
Description:
Hansel is too greedy and wants to eat all the cookies from the roof of the witch her house.  But he has to be carefull because the witch who is disguised as a pigeon will prevent him.

The board looks like a house with on top 3 places to put a card.  Shuffle the deck of cards and put three cards on these locations.  Then you put a pigeon figure on the roof in one of the three slots above a card.  There is also a Hansel figure, place this on the table.

At his turn a player may turn over a card from the deck.  If the card doesn't match the card under the pigeon nothing happens and the player may take the card.  The player can turn over as many cards as he wants.  If he wants to stop he can take all the cards that he has turned over.  But if he turns the same card  that is under the pigeon then the player has to make the sound of a pigeon and take the pigeon figure from the roof to prevent the witch from coming down.  At the same time each other player may try to take the hansel figure.  The first person who does this gets the first card of the open pile, and all the cards go to a discard pile.  So the player who turned the cards lost all his cards (except maybe one).  The witch is then put in a slot on the roof again.

A player that took Hansel by mistake has to give in a card he won in a previous round.

When the drawing deck is empty the game stops.  The player with the most cards wins the game.

Name: De Wereld Rond
Description:
Subtitle of this old Dutch game: "Intellectueel en interessant gezelschapsspel voor jong en oud". 
Up to 6 player try to voyage around the world as fast as possible. Each player follows a 'private' route and has to visit 20 different places. It is also possible that 'somtehing' happens during the trip...

Name: RAID: Random Adventures In Dungeons
Description:
RAID - Random Adventures in Dungeons is a fast-paced, easy to learn, action/adventure RPG from Double Aye Games.

Enter an ever-changing world where no two games will ever be the same.  Battle monsters while seeking untold riches and the way out of the dungeon.  Work with your friends, or leave them to be eaten by the monsters while you take off with the loot!

Choose from 7 customizable character types:
Wizard, Warrior, Archer, Monk, Paladin, Thief, or Cleric.

Equip your character with weapons and armor you gain from your battles. Watch out for traps!  There is a new surprise around every corner and no two dungeons are ever the same.

Name: This Is Your Life
Description: Based on famous TV show from the 1950's starring Ralph Edwards. In it, famous people would be surprised by Edwards and would wind up on his show where people from that celebrities past would appear as special guests. The object of the game was to fill in as many of the areas of the celebrities past as possible including using the Charm Bracelet for friends and family. This game lets you figure out which famous person Edwards has chosen to honor during the game.

Name: TRICK x 5
Description: The players move their five pieces with numbers on them around the board trying to put at least three of them in line with a total of 5 or a multiple of 5. They then write down the sum as score points and continue playing until one player reaches 200.

Name: Kosmojet
Description:
The year is 5777. 3,000 years ago the scientists thought that the Sun was going to explode. Therefore the humanity had to leave Earth, looking for a hospitable planet. Four different empires were created and they forgot the solar system and the planet where the humanity evolved. Now, 3,000 years later, the scientists have discovered that the  solar system still survives. Each of the four empires decide to conquer the cradle of humanity for itself... a space conflict is about to erupt!

Kosmojet is an educational game on the Solar System and for developing memory and dexterity skills. Each player represents one empire and must reconquer the Solar System planet by planet by means of a classical memory-style competition as well as some dexterity matches.

Name: Harlequin Checkers
Description:
From Zillions of Games

"Pieces move diagonally but capture orthogonally. This is so as to combine the forced progression of diagonal checkers with the richness of the orthogonal game.

Object: Capture all your opponent's pieces ("Checkers" or "Kings") by jumping over them, or stalemate the opponent so he has no moves.

Checkers can move diagonally forward, by sliding to an adjacent empty square or by jumping either left, right, or forward over an enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Jumping over a piece captures it, but you may not jump diagonally. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible, taking the maximum number of pieces.

The King is a long range piece and can slide diagonally in any direction or jump left, right, up or down over any opponent piece to any free square. When your Checker stops on the other end of the board, it becomes a King and can then also move backwards. If it merely visits a promotion square during a series capture moves, then it does not promote."

Name: Hopperdame
Description:
From Hopperdame website ( http://mlwi.magix.net/bg/hopperdame.htm )

HopperDame (or simply Hoppers) is a new invention. In HopperDame with promotion rule you win by capturing all the opponent's pieces. Pieces move forwards and sideways, orthogonally or diagonally, by shifting to an adjacent square, or by jumping over an adjacent friendly piece (also termed 'hopper'). Jumps must only occur over a piece of the same colour. It's not allowable to step or jump backwards. The exception to this is the "king", which can jump over any piece, and step in all directions.

To promote to king one must conquer the "castles", that is, the corner squares behind the enemy position, by holding both these positions with a piece, so called "double-promotion". If a piece steps or jumps into the enemy corner then it is promoted to king only if the other enemy corner is already occupied by a friendly piece. Also, a piece which steps into the corner square may later be promoted if the other corner has subsequently become occupied by a friendly piece. The promotion is then done by dropping the piece on the same square. But this costs a move.

HopperDame employs the rule of exchange-capture: the counter jumps over a friendly counter. If the square where it lands is occupied by an enemy counter, then this is captured. It is only when leaping that the counter can make captures. A leaping counter may continue to leap over friendly counters until there are no more to leap over or the player decides to stop. It's not allowable to jump back to the square you just came from.

Note that capture is only made when jumping. Thus, a single piece cannot make a capture by itself. The exception to this is the king, which has an additional capture method: it can capture an adjacent enemy piece directly, like a king in chess.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Time Traveler
Description:
Take your Age of Steam experience to the next dimension! Age of Steam: Time Traveler Expansion comes with several new maps that represent not only different locations, but also different times as well, and adds an exciting twist as players travel from one map to another using time portals.  Rather than the usual board with one single large map, the game features multiple considerably smaller maps, each representing a different era of time, and together make up the game board.  In addition to building routes within a particular smaller map, players will be able to `travel' from one map in time to another map.

Game-play and theme is similar to that of Railways Through Time, the forthcoming expansion for Railways of the World.

Name: Poker Face
Description:
SUMMARY:

Poker Face is a board game of betting/wagering, not Lady Gaga, and money can NOT be used in playing the game. Each game consists of 7 matches. In the beginning of each match, a Match Card is drawn. Players follow the steps on the card to prepare the match, place bets and play action cards to alter the result in their favors. When the objective meets after playing rounds of action cards, the match ends. The winners receive points and the losers may receive penalty based on their bets. After 7 matches, player with the highest score wins the game.

COMPONENTS:

Board x 1
Objective Cards x 8
Action Cards x 108
Starting Player token x 1
Player token x 24
Power token x 8
Game Round marker x 1
Rule x 1


            
        
    


1) First edition is Simplified Chinese.
2) There are 36 types of action card, based on the ancient Chinese 36 stratagems.

Name: History of the rails
Description:
An 18xx game + "History of the world" set in the Tokyo metropolitan area of Japan.

This game consists of five Epoches and a player manages a railroad company by each Epoch.  
A player gains the score according to the profit of the company which managed like 18xx.  
The player with the most score is declared the winner.

Name: Imperiale Strategie
Description: A diceless game of strategy set in the Napoleonic era. The game comes with 3 maps: Austerlitz, Borodino and Villodrigo. The players manage one army each (either blue or white). These armies are identical with only the generals being different. The blue army appear to represent France and the white army seems more generic. This game uses a square pattern for the maps. Each square has a strength value depending of the type of terrain represented in it. For example, in squares representing plains, the cavalry unit are strongest, but it is rather different for the cities and wooded terrain types. Each army contains artillery, cavalry, infantry and guard units. The artillery units must be used by infantry or guard units, never alone. The objectives include the destruction of the opponent's army, eliminating the opponent's general or capturing cities.

Name: Wenchkins
Description:
One or two player square and counter wargame by Sir Basil about a battle between Amazonian-like warrior women called Wenchkins.  Each army of Wenchkins has its own Queen and Executioner.  There is also a Monster that runs around indiscriminately devouring Wenckins.

From the rules:
". . .each Queen starts as a prisoner of the other side; the object of the game is to annihilate all enemy Wenchkins, torture the enemy Queen to death, and, if possible, rescue the friendly Queen before she is tortured to death by the enemy."

Players take turns maneuvering their Wenchkin forces and engaging in combat - while avoiding the Monster and Torturing their prisoner Queens. The Wenchkins are very aggressive and are compelled to engage anything they come into contact with.

Name: Shahbol
Description:
Shahbol is a cross between chess and football.
The game is played on a field size of 5x8 cells. Gates occupy the first and last row of the field.
Each player has 7 pieces: 3 forwards, 3 defense and a goalie, another figure depicts the ball. Players move the one piece per turn, trying to send the ball into the opponent's gate.

Name: Monkey Party
Description:
From the back of the box:

Be as clever as a "monkey" and take on the challenge!

One after the other, each player takes a card. When two identical monkeys follow one another, be the fastest to touch stack of cards!
Be lively because the last player will have to collect all the played cards.
Be careful of the tricks and the tactics of your opponents...
This exiting game will create unforgettable moments in a fun-filled eviroment of laughter!
Agility and observation are the keys to winning the game. Monkey Party will really test your reflexes!

Name: ColorFever
Description:
From the Back Cover:

Colorfever is point scoring game combining a perfect blend of strategy and chance.
You draw tiles, roll the dice, and place your tile accordingly. You score by building strings of tiles horizontally, vertically and diagonally. With every turn comes the chance to draw special tiles that give you extraordinary action!

Players take turns drawing a tile of one of five colors and then placing it in one of a limited choice of columns based on a die roll. The columns are built from the bottom up, much as in Connect 4. At the end of the game, players will score for horizontal, vertical, and diagonal runs of all-different tiles and all-alike tiles. Several special tiles and board spaces create additional scoring opportunities.

Name: Pancakes
Description:
(From the back of the box):

Pancakes is a simple and easy game to play.  Build stacks of pancakes, add butter to increase the value of the stack, then top it off with syrup before someone else to score the stack!

The game takes minutes to learn and is simple enough to be enjoyed by the whole family!

Name: Barclay City Life Game
Description:
The board displays the map of a city.
